title: Process Discovery
descrption: Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes on a system. Information obtained could be used to gain an understanding of common software running on systems within the network. Adversaries may use the information from Process Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.WindowsAn example command that would obtain details on processes is "tasklist" using the Tasklist utility.Mac and LinuxIn Mac and Linux, this is accomplished with the ps command.
System Requirements: Administrator, SYSTEM may provide better process ownership details

related.Name: 4H RAT
related.Description: 4H RAT has the capability to obtain a listing of running processes (including loaded modules).[85]

related.Name: ADVSTORESHELL
related.Description: ADVSTORESHELL can list running processes.[45]

related.Name: Agent Tesla
related.Description: Agent Tesla lists the current running processes on the system.[53]

related.Name: APT1
related.Description: APT1 gathered a list of running processes on the system using tasklist /v.[111]

related.Name: APT28
related.Description: An APT28 loader Trojan will enumerate the victim's processes searching for explorer.exe if its current process does not have necessary permissions.[34]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: APT3 has a tool that can list out currently running processes.[114][115]

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37's Freenki malware lists running processes using the Microsoft Windows API.[109]

related.Name: APT38
related.Description: APT38 leveraged Sysmon to understand the processes, services in the organization.[112]

related.Name: Astaroth
related.Description: Astaroth searches for different processes on the system.[97]

related.Name: Azorult
related.Description: Azorult can collect a list of running processes by calling CreateToolhelp32Snapshot.[60][61]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has executed the tasklist command.    [107]

related.Name: Backdoor.Oldrea
related.Description: Backdoor.Oldrea collects information about running processes.[13]

related.Name: BACKSPACE
related.Description: BACKSPACE may collect information about running processes.[14]

related.Name: Bankshot
related.Description: Bankshot identifies processes and collects the process ids.[42]

related.Name: BBSRAT
related.Description: BBSRAT can list running processes.[23]

related.Name: BISCUIT
related.Description: BISCUIT has a command to enumerate running processes and identify their owners.[71]

related.Name: Bisonal
related.Description: Bisonal can obtain a list of running processes on the victim’s machine.[35]

related.Name: BLACKCOFFEE
related.Description: BLACKCOFFEE has the capability to discover processes.[57]

related.Name: BlackEnergy
related.Description: BlackEnergy has gathered a process list by using Tasklist.exe.[32][33]

related.Name: Brave Prince
related.Description: Brave Prince lists the running processes.[52]

related.Name: Cannon
related.Description: Cannon can obtain a list of processes running on the system.[27][28]

related.Name: Carbanak
related.Description: Carbanak lists running processes.[31]

related.Name: Carbon
related.Description: Carbon can list the processes on the victim’s machine.[66]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT contains watchdog functionality that ensures its process is always running, else spawns a new instance.[72]

related.Name: ChChes
related.Description: ChChes collects its process identifier (PID) on the victim.[58]

related.Name: Cobalt Strike
related.Description: Cobalt Strike's "beacon" payload can collect information on process details.[2]

related.Name: Comnie
related.Description: Comnie uses the tasklist to view running processes on the victim’s machine.[8]

related.Name: Crimson
related.Description: Crimson contains a command to list processes.[40]

related.Name: DarkComet
related.Description: DarkComet can list active processes running on the victim’s machine.[65]

related.Name: Darkhotel
related.Description: Darkhotel has searched for anti-malware strings and anti-virus processes running on the system.[125]

related.Name: Deep Panda
related.Description: Deep Panda uses the Microsoft Tasklist utility to list processes running on systems.[117]

related.Name: Derusbi
related.Description: Derusbi collects current and parent process IDs.[43][44]

related.Name: Duqu
related.Description: The discovery modules used with Duqu can collect information on process details.[82]

related.Name: DustySky
related.Description: DustySky collects information about running processes from victims.[12]

related.Name: Elise
related.Description: Elise enumerates processes via the tasklist command.[62]

related.Name: ELMER
related.Description: ELMER is capable of performing process listings.[17]

related.Name: Emotet
related.Description: Emotet has been observed enumerating local processes.[96]

related.Name: Empire
related.Description: Empire can find information about processes running on local and remote systems.[6]

related.Name: Epic
related.Description: Epic uses the tasklist /v command to obtain a list of processes.[69][70]

related.Name: EvilBunny
related.Description: EvilBunny has used EnumProcesses() to identify how many process are running in the environment.[103]

related.Name: FELIXROOT
related.Description: FELIXROOT collects a list of running processes.[78]

related.Name: Final1stspy
related.Description: Final1stspy obtains a list of running processes.[79]

related.Name: FinFisher
related.Description: FinFisher checks its parent process for indications that it is running in a sandbox setup.[83][84]

related.Name: FruitFly
related.Description: FruitFly has the ability to list processes on the system.[22]

related.Name: Fysbis
related.Description: Fysbis can collect information about running processes. [106]

related.Name: GeminiDuke
related.Description: GeminiDuke collects information on running processes and environment variables from the victim.[29]

related.Name: gh0st RAT
related.Description: gh0st RAT has the capability to list processes.[89]

related.Name: Gold Dragon
related.Description: Gold Dragon checks the running processes on the victim’s machine.[52]

related.Name: GravityRAT
related.Description: GravityRAT lists the running processes on the system.[50]

related.Name: HALFBAKED
related.Description: HALFBAKED can obtain information about running processes on the victim.[68]

related.Name: Helminth
related.Description: Helminth has used Tasklist to get information on processes.[34]

related.Name: Honeybee
related.Description: Honeybee gathers a list of processes using the tasklist command and then is sent back to the control server.[110]

related.Name: Hydraq
related.Description: Hydraq creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can monitor processes.[54][55]

related.Name: iKitten
related.Description: iKitten lists the current processes running.[22]

related.Name: InvisiMole
related.Description: InvisiMole obtains a list of running processes.[10]

related.Name: Ixeshe
related.Description: Ixeshe can list running processes.[101]

related.Name: JHUHUGIT
related.Description: JHUHUGIT obtains a list of running processes on the victim.[86][87]

related.Name: JPIN
related.Description: JPIN can list running processes.[7]

related.Name: jRAT
related.Description: jRAT can query and kill system processes.[98]

related.Name: Kasidet
related.Description: Kasidet has the ability to search for a given process name in processes currently running in the system.[92]

related.Name: Kazuar
related.Description: Kazuar obtains a list of running processes through WMI querying and the ps command.[37]

related.Name: Ke3chang
related.Description: Ke3chang performs process discovery using tasklist commands.[118][119]

related.Name: KEYMARBLE
related.Description: KEYMARBLE can obtain a list of running processes on the system.[21]

related.Name: Komplex
related.Description: The OsInfo function in Komplex collects a running process list.[74]

related.Name: Kwampirs
related.Description: Kwampirs collects a list of running services with the command tasklist /v.[41]

related.Name: Lazarus Group
related.Description: Several Lazarus Group malware families gather a list of running processes on a victim system and send it to their C2 server. A Destover-like variant used by Lazarus Group also gathers process times.[120][121][122][39]

related.Name: Linfo
related.Description: Linfo creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can retrieve a list of running processes.[80]

related.Name: Machete
related.Description: Machete has a component to check for running processes to look for web browsers. [104]

related.Name: Magic Hound
related.Description: Magic Hound malware can list running processes.[126]

related.Name: MobileOrder
related.Description: MobileOrder has a command to upload information about all running processes to its C2 server.[67]

related.Name: Molerats
related.Description: Molerats actors obtained a list of active processes on the victim and sent them to C2 servers.[12]

related.Name: MoonWind
related.Description: MoonWind has a command to return a list of running processes.[75]

related.Name: Mosquito
related.Description: Mosquito runs tasklist to obtain running processes.[19]

related.Name: MuddyWater
related.Description: MuddyWater has used malware to obtain a list of running processes on the system.[127]

related.Name: NavRAT
related.Description: NavRAT uses tasklist /v to check running processes.[30]

related.Name: NETEAGLE
related.Description: NETEAGLE can send process listings over the C2 channel.[14]

related.Name: OceanSalt
related.Description: OceanSalt can collect the name and ID for every process running on the system.[26]

related.Name: OilRig
related.Description: OilRig has run tasklist on a victim's machine.[108]

related.Name: Orz
related.Description: Orz can gather a process list from the victim.[20]

related.Name: Pasam
related.Description: Pasam creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can retrieve lists of running processes.[51]

related.Name: PLAINTEE
related.Description: PLAINTEE performs the tasklist command to list running processes.[36]

related.Name: PlugX
related.Description: PlugX has a module to list the processes running on a machine.[15]

related.Name: POORAIM
related.Description: POORAIM can enumerate processes.[16]

related.Name: Poseidon Group
related.Description: After compromising a victim, Poseidon Group lists all running processes.[116]

related.Name: PowerDuke
related.Description: PowerDuke has a command to list the victim's processes.[18]

related.Name: PowerSploit
related.Description: PowerSploit's Get-ProcessTokenPrivilege Privesc-PowerUp module can enumerate privileges for a given process.[3][4]

related.Name: PowerStallion
related.Description: PowerStallion has been used to monitor process lists.[102]

related.Name: POWRUNER
related.Description: POWRUNER may collect process information by running tasklist on a victim.[25]

related.Name: Proxysvc
related.Description: Proxysvc lists processes running on the system.[39]

related.Name: Pupy
related.Description: Pupy can list the running processes and get the process ID and parent process’s ID.[1]

related.Name: RATANKBA
related.Description: RATANKBA lists the system’s processes.[46][47]

related.Name: Remsec
related.Description: Remsec can obtain a process list from the victim.[81]

related.Name: RogueRobin
related.Description: RogueRobin checks the running processes for evidence it may be running in a sandbox environment. It specifically enumerates processes for Wireshark and Sysinternals.[77]

related.Name: ROKRAT
related.Description: ROKRAT lists the current running processes on the system.[64]

related.Name: RTM
related.Description: RTM can obtain information about process integrity levels.[9]

related.Name: Seasalt
related.Description: Seasalt has a command to perform a process listing.[71]

related.Name: SHOTPUT
related.Description: SHOTPUT has a command to obtain a process listing.[11]

related.Name: Socksbot
related.Description: Socksbot can list all running processes.[88]

related.Name: Stealth Falcon
related.Description: Stealth Falcon malware gathers a list of running processes.[124]

related.Name: StreamEx
related.Description: StreamEx has the ability to enumerate processes.[73]

related.Name: Sykipot
related.Description: Sykipot may gather a list of running processes by running tasklist /v.[38]

related.Name: SynAck
related.Description: SynAck enumerates all running processes.[48][49]

related.Name: Tasklist
related.Description: Tasklist can be used to discover processes running on a system.[5]

related.Name: Trojan.Karagany
related.Description: Trojan.Karagany can use tasklist to collect a list of running tasks.[13]

related.Name: Tropic Trooper
related.Description: Tropic Trooper enumerates the running processes on the system.[123]

related.Name: Turla
related.Description: Turla surveys a system upon check-in to discover running processes using the tasklist /v command. Turla RPC backdoors have also enumerated processes associated with specific open ports or named pipes.[69][102]

related.Name: UBoatRAT
related.Description: UBoatRAT can list running processes on the system.[24]

related.Name: Ursnif
related.Description: Ursnif has gathered information about running processes.[99][100]

related.Name: VERMIN
related.Description: VERMIN can get a list of the processes and running tasks on the system.[59]

related.Name: Volgmer
related.Description: Volgmer can gather a list of processes.[63]

related.Name: WINERACK
related.Description: WINERACK can enumerate processes.[16]

related.Name: WinMM
related.Description: WinMM sets a WH_CBT Windows hook to collect information on process creation.[90]

related.Name: Winnti Group
related.Description: Winnti Group looked for a specific process running on infected servers.[113]

related.Name: XAgentOSX
related.Description: XAgentOSX contains the getProcessList function to run ps aux to get running processes.[56]

related.Name: yty
related.Description: yty gets an output of running processes using the tasklist command.[76]

related.Name: Zebrocy
related.Description: Zebrocy uses the tasklist and wmic process get Capture, ExecutablePath commands to gather the processes running on the system.[27][93][28][94][95]

related.Name: Zeus Panda
related.Description: Zeus Panda checks for running processes on the victim’s machine.[91]

related.Name: ZxShell
related.Description: ZxShell has a command, ps, to obtain a listing of processes on the system. [105]
